data.job_description:
Join our fast-growing team! You will help support our team as we build a robust data engine to build business-critical, scalable, and robust data pipelines and intuitive data products that power data discovery and analysis. You will help support build Vee’s data capability and data strategy.
• Learn AWS serverless development using Python
• Help architect, design, and code serverless solutions using our AWS Cloud storage and computer layers
• Do technical research on platforms and services to support our architecture decisions
• Help solve some workflows challenges in mission critical applications
• Help support our code repository
• Write or contribute to agile documentation and help establish, socialize, and audit best practices

General Responsibilities
• Partner with DevOps, Data Engineer and Data Scientist interns, People Science and other teams
• Participate in standups
• Learn and operate in an Agile process using Jira

Core Experience & Requirements
• Software Engineering experience with high proficiency in Python
• Proficient SQL skills
• Familiarity with (proficiency preferred) Python plotting/charting libraries and Platform-as-a Service

Preferred Experience
• Experience with some or all the following AWS products: S3, Redshift, Lambda, Code Pipeline
• Experience with CI CD
• Code management in GitHub
• Writing Integrations using AWS API Gateways
• Working with Vendor REST APIs

Profile

Purpose is what drives you. Your passion for your work has led you here. You are ready to combine your experience with ours to help our client companies gain competitive advantage. You bring strong creative thinking skills in addition to superior communication skills, allowing you to develop creative solutions for any challenge that comes your way.

You:
• Love what you do, love to be busy, and love to produce by being organized and methodical
• Work with a sense of urgency and have a strong drive for results
• Have the resilience and agility to adapt quickly in a fast-paced environment
• Work independently as well as collaboratively to stretch thinking into creative solutions
• Have strong verbal and written communication skills
• Are excited about and suited for a startup, where you’ll be wearing a few hats
• Are smart and fun with an empathetic nature, which will add to our culture

Qualifications: Learn AWS serverless development using Python
Software Engineering experience with high proficiency in Python
Proficient SQL skills

data.job_description:
Treehouse Strategy is a management consulting company that specializes in helping language companies around the world grow and get to the next level. We work with language companies on sales strategies, marketing plans, marketing initiatives execution (rebranding strategy, website redesign, social media management, SEO, etc.), technology advisory, and merger & acquisition advisory and brokerage. We have clients in Greece, France, UK, Argentina, Spain, the US, and Taiwan.
Job Description

We are looking for a Python development intern. This is an unpaid internship position.

The Python development intern will help us develop and maintain Python scripts that automate testing.
• Write clean, high-quality scripts that test product functionality automatically.
• Conduct various tests for systems, networks, applications, databases, software.
• Log and document errors in the tracking system.
• Identify specific cases that should be automated and discuss them with manual QA engineers.
• Develop the best automation solutions based on the requirements.
• Participate in AQA plannings to define the sprint scope.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams (developers, product manager) to find ways on how automation can improve the workflow.
• Take part in brainstorms to come up with new ideas and designs that improve existing features.

Additional Information
• Are you able to work the hours of Mon-Fri, 9 AM to 6 PM, Eastern Standard Time?
• Are you able and willing to work outside of traditional local hours, if need be?
• What is your level of English proficiency? What is your level of English proficiency in the CEFR scale or equivalent?

Responsibilities: The Python development intern will help us develop and maintain Python scripts that automate testing
Write clean, high-quality scripts that test product functionality automatically
Conduct various tests for systems, networks, applications, databases, software
Log and document errors in the tracking system
Identify specific cases that should be automated and discuss them with manual QA engineers
Develop the best automation solutions based on the requirements
Participate in AQA plannings to define the sprint scope
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (developers, product manager) to find ways on how automation can improve the workflow
Take part in brainstorms to come up with new ideas and designs that improve existing features

data.job_title: Data Science Intern (Python, Image Processing) Pharma
data.job_description:
About the role

At ICON, it’s our people that set us apart. Our diverse teams enable us to become a better partner to our customers and help us to fulfil our mission to advance and improve patients’ lives.

Our ‘Own It’ culture is driven by four key values that bring us together as individuals and set us apart as an organisation: Accountability & Delivery, Collaboration, Partnership and Integrity. We want to be the Clinical Research Organisation that delivers excellence to our clients and to patients at every touch-point. In short, to be the partner of choice in drug development.

That’s our vision. We’re driven by it. And we need talented people who share it.

If you’re as driven as we are, join us. You’ll be working in a dynamic and supportive environment, with some of the brightest and the friendliest people in the sector, and you’ll be helping shape an industry.

Healthcare Intelligence Experts.

Symphony Health, part of the ICON plc family, is a team of curious thinkers and intellectual problem solvers driving the healthcare data industry forward. We leverage our large, integrated healthcare data repository and our analytic expertise to build customized, agile data solutions which answer the questions our clients -- life science manufacturers, payers, and providers -- have today, as well as those they’ll have tomorrow. Together, we can help patients get the right drugs at the right times.

Symphony Health is looking to place talented students in an exciting and fast paced summer internship program!

With this internship, students will have the opportunity to gain invaluable exposure to predictive modeling projects, hands on experience coding and working with Python and SQL, and mentoring at a healthcare industry leader in data analytics and technology solutions.

What will you do?

The Intern will support our Custom & Advanced Analytics team, including Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and Consultants at the intersection of business and technology. Utilizing your interest in Predictive Modeling, as well as your strong Python skills, you will help our team pursue proof of concept projects and push into new, innovative techniques.

Some additional responsibilities may include:
• Compile and analyze data and prepares reports.
• Provide administrative assistance in support of special projects.
• May create and develop presentations.

What do you need to have?
• 0 – 2 Years of related experience
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required
• Strongly prefer current enrollment in graduate studies, preferably in Business, Business Analytics, Statistics, Physical Sciences, or related area
• Deep experience using Python and related tools, including Pandas, Matplotlib, NumPy, Sci-Kit Learn, Seaborn, Plotly, and Dash
• Basic SQL skills
• Well versed in statistical analysis and predictive modeling
• Experience or deep interest in healthcare
• Experience with MS Outlook, Word, and Excel
• Good organizational and time management skills, with strong attention to detail
• Good communication and interpersonal skills
• Read, write and speak English fluently
• Availability to work full time

Benefits of Working in ICON:

Our success depends on the quality of our people. That’s why we’ve made it a priority to build a culture that rewards high performance and nurtures talent.

We offer very competitive salary packages. And to keep them competitive, we regularly benchmark them against our competitors. Our annual bonuses reflect delivery of performance goals – both ours and yours.

We also provide a range of health-related benefits to employees and their families and offer competitive retirement plans – and related benefits such as life assurance – so you can save and plan with confidence for the years ahead.

But beyond the competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits, you’ll benefit from an environment where you are encouraged to fulfil your sense of purpose and drive lasting change.

ICON is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know through the form below.

Qualifications: 0 – 2 Years of related experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required
Strongly prefer current enrollment in graduate studies, preferably in Business, Business Analytics, Statistics, Physical Sciences, or related area
Deep experience using Python and related tools, including Pandas, Matplotlib, NumPy, Sci-Kit Learn, Seaborn, Plotly, and Dash
Basic SQL skills
Well versed in statistical analysis and predictive modeling
Experience or deep interest in healthcare
Experience with MS Outlook, Word, and Excel
Good organizational and time management skills, with strong attention to detail
Good communication and interpersonal skills
Read, write and speak English fluently
Availability to work full time
Responsibilities: The Intern will support our Custom & Advanced Analytics team, including Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and Consultants at the intersection of business and technology
Utilizing your interest in Predictive Modeling, as well as your strong Python skills, you will help our team pursue proof of concept projects and push into new, innovative techniques
Compile and analyze data and prepares reports
Provide administrative assistance in support of special projects
May create and develop presentations
Benefits: We offer very competitive salary packages
Our annual bonuses reflect delivery of performance goals – both ours and yours

We also provide a range of health-related benefits to employees and their families and offer competitive retirement plans – and related benefits such as life assurance – so you can save and plan with confidence for the years ahead
But beyond the competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits, you’ll benefit from an environment where you are encouraged to fulfil your sense of purpose and drive lasting change

data.job_title: Python Developer for Data Analysis Intern - Summer 2023
data.job_description:
Do you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology - with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe. Welcome to Bosch.

The Chassis Controls division, which is part of the Mobility Solutions area, develops innovative solutions for active driving safety. Most commonly known safety products are Anti-lock Braking Systems (ABS), Traction Control Systems (TCS) and Electronic Stability Control (ESC). But our scope also includes base brake actuation and goes much further with Driver Assistance Systems such as Adaptive Cruise Control (ACC) and many more functions. For our organization, this is more than just business, it is about contributing to Society by helping to save lives. And for our great engineers contributing to this mission, it is more than just a job, it is a passion.
Job Description

You will be part of an energetic, motivated and forward-thinking team within Bosch developing connected brake systems [IoT based development]. Your main activities will be:
• Develop medium-to-large scale Python repositories for the analyses of field braking systems’ technical data
• Implement theoretical requirements provided by the Data Scientist and generate reports using automation
• Work with Restful APIs, visualization and statistical libraries in Python
• Conduct comprehensive testing of the workflows developed and document the testing process
• Review the scalability, readability, and repeatability of the developed workflows and refactor the existing workflows to meet these requirements

Qualifications
• Mandatory:
• Skilled in Jupyter, Pandas, Numpy, and Matplotlib
• Pursuing a BS or MS in engineering with at least one semester completed
• Minimum GPA of 3.0
• Must be 18 years of age
• Available 40hrs/week
• Preferred
• Skilled in Seaborn, Scikit-learn, PyLatex, Rest API, Git
• Knowhow of Embedded systems or automotive engineering or big data engineering

Additional Information

By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce - EOE/Protected Veteran/Disabled.

BOSCH is a proud supporter of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics) Initiatives

· FIRST Robotics (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology)

· AWIM (A World In Motion)

Indefinite U.S. work authorized individuals only. Future sponsorship for work authorization unavailable.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Qualifications: Mandatory:
Skilled in Jupyter, Pandas, Numpy, and Matplotlib
Pursuing a BS or MS in engineering with at least one semester completed
Minimum GPA of 3.0
Must be 18 years of age
Available 40hrs/week
Skilled in Seaborn, Scikit-learn, PyLatex, Rest API, Git
Knowhow of Embedded systems or automotive engineering or big data engineering
Responsibilities: You will be part of an energetic, motivated and forward-thinking team within Bosch developing connected brake systems [IoT based development]
Develop medium-to-large scale Python repositories for the analyses of field braking systems’ technical data
Implement theoretical requirements provided by the Data Scientist and generate reports using automation
Work with Restful APIs, visualization and statistical libraries in Python
Conduct comprehensive testing of the workflows developed and document the testing process
Review the scalability, readability, and repeatability of the developed workflows and refactor the existing workflows to meet these requirements

data.job_naics_name: Other Motor Vehicle Electrical and Electronic Equipment Manufacturing

data.job_description:
Overall Responsibility

Videon launched a Cloud platform used to configure and monitor fleets of on-prem video processing devices used for sports gamification, interactive video and video cloud contribution. This platform is built on AWS, with a serverless design and leverages a dozen of AWS services. AWS Software Engineers at Videon are responsible for developing and testing software modules that enable new features or enhance and optimize existing functionalities of the product. They typically need to solve problems involving scalability, performance and cost of running these Cloud services.

Key Areas of Responsibility
• Create working, quality software through a combination of coding, verification, unit testing and debugging.
• Evaluate product quality and improve quality by identifying defects and problems.
• Provide cost-effective support to software during the pre-delivery and post-delivery stage.

Consults With

Engineering Manager, Software Team, Quality Test Agents, Product Team, Customers, and others as appropriate

Qualifications
• Proficiency with serverless Cloud architectures and Infrastructure as Code principles.
• Knowledge of usual AWS services including Lambda, DynamoDB, API Gateway, S3, Cognito, IoT Core.
• Knowledge of Python and Javascript (VueJS is a plus). Other web backend and frontend technologies are desirable.
• Knowledge of embedded software (Linux/Android) and media technologies such as FFmpeg / libav, live555, GStreamer, VLC or OpenMax is desirable but not required.
• Knowledge of the AWS Elemental media services is desirable but not required.
• Composure and professional, thoughtful decision-making in a fast and sometimes ambiguous environment.
• Excellent written and verbal communication with the ability to effectively coordinate with internal and external teams.
• Active Listening--Giving full attention to what people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.
• Active Learning--Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem solving and decision making.
• Critical Thinking--Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems.

Travel requirements and on-boarding
• Some travel may be required.
• The on-boarding process for this role requires a period of ramping up as a pre-sales technical engineer, to learn how customers use Videon products.

Educational requirements
• Bachelor degree in a technical field

Experience requirements
• 2+ years of software development experience

Qualifications: Proficiency with serverless Cloud architectures and Infrastructure as Code principles
Knowledge of usual AWS services including Lambda, DynamoDB, API Gateway, S3, Cognito, IoT Core
Composure and professional, thoughtful decision-making in a fast and sometimes ambiguous environment
Excellent written and verbal communication with the ability to effectively coordinate with internal and external teams
Active Listening--Giving full attention to what people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times
Active Learning--Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem solving and decision making
Critical Thinking--Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems
Travel requirements and on-boarding
Bachelor degree in a technical field
2+ years of software development experience

data.job_description:
We use Machine Learning in almost every part of the product — feed ranking, NLP, answer ranking, search, topic and user recommendations, spam detection etc. As a machine learning intern, you’ll have the unique opportunity of bringing the cutting edge machine learning research into a product that affect over 300 million users. With Quora's experiment framework, you can see how your work during the internship affect the user engagement through A/B testing experiment.

About our Internship:

A Quora internship is not an ordinary internship. There's no busy work. Every project that our interns work on is important to the company and its goals.

As a team, we are dedicated to holding high standards, developing a strong and passionate culture, and emphasizing impact. We value building a culture with strong engineering values and goals because we believe that it is the key to building a great company and product. Interns play an important role in this, as they work alongside full-time employees as equals, working on the same projects that help drive the company and product forward. We expect interns to become valuable contributors to the team, as they work hand-in-hand with people ranging from engineering to design to business development.

We also realize that mentorship is important to allow interns to grow and develop skills in areas which they're looking to improve. For example, every intern will have a full-time engineer as a mentor, and weekly 1:1s with their managers to get feedback and ensure things are going well. We also emphasize code reviews and hold weekly engineering tech talks to maintain high code quality and to optimize for learning the best engineering practices.

Responsibilities:
• Improve our existing Machine Learning systems using your core expertise
• Identify new opportunities to apply Machine Learning to different parts of the Quora product
• Work with other Machine Learning engineers to implement algorithms and systems in an efficient way

Minimum Qualifications:
• Pursuing a B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical field
• Strong understanding of mathematical foundations of Machine Learning algorithms
• Knowledge of Python or C++, or the ability to learn them quickly
• A passion for learning and always improving yourself and the team around you

Preferred Qualifications:
• Previous software engineering experience via an internship, work experience or coding competition
• Passion for Quora's mission and goals

Qualifications: Pursuing a B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical field
Strong understanding of mathematical foundations of Machine Learning algorithms
Knowledge of Python or C++, or the ability to learn them quickly
A passion for learning and always improving yourself and the team around you
Responsibilities: As a machine learning intern, you’ll have the unique opportunity of bringing the cutting edge machine learning research into a product that affect over 300 million users
For example, every intern will have a full-time engineer as a mentor, and weekly 1:1s with their managers to get feedback and ensure things are going well
We also emphasize code reviews and hold weekly engineering tech talks to maintain high code quality and to optimize for learning the best engineering practices
Improve our existing Machine Learning systems using your core expertise
Identify new opportunities to apply Machine Learning to different parts of the Quora product
Work with other Machine Learning engineers to implement algorithms and systems in an efficient way

data.job_naics_name: Internet Publishing and Broadcasting and Web Search Portals

data.job_description:
Software Engineer Intern

Company: Hitachi America, Ltd.

Division: Social Innovation Business (SIB)

Location: Remote work with up to 10% travel (as needed)

Status: Intern, full time

Duration: 6 months from June 2021 – December 2022

Summary:

Hitachi Global Social Innovation Business (GSIB) is searching for a passionate Software Engineering intern who is comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment to assist with the development of new digital solutions that solve market-based problems.

GSIB is a division within Hitachi that is focused on delivering cutting edge, next-generation digital solutions to Hitachi customers, partners and ecosystems, with the goal of delivering economic, environmental and social value to society and improving the quality of life for people around the world. This position will play a role in developing and prototyping new solutions that solve real world problems.

Responsibilities:
• Review and categorize existing pods of code for potential utilization in upcoming projects and demos
• Create and present architecture and programing overviews to internal and external partner groups
• Solve complex problems through prototyping of new tools and validating resolution
• Support cloud-based initiatives of data storage, collection and mining
• Engage with GSIB stakeholders to source information and requirements
• Liaise with outside vendors and/or agencies as needed to support the work
• Manage a range of development projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment

Qualifications:
• Must be currently enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s degree program in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
• Experience / knowledge of coding web-based software using Python, Java, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, HTML, XML, or CSS required
• Demonstrated knowledge in cloud solutions like AWS, Azure or GCP preferred
• Experience with IoT, Edge Devices and other sensor-based solutions preferred
• Good quantitative analytical skills
• Good oral and written communication skills
• Ability to demonstrate initiative, critical thinking and problem-solving
• Ability to work independently as well as with a team
• Ability to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
• Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
• Detail oriented and goal oriented with aptitude and enthusiasm for learning

data.job_description:
JOB SUMMARY:

The Three Wire Systems (TWS) Software Developer Intern will support the company’s Digital Services Division ensuring all activities are in line with the Director of Digital Services priorities.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
• Work with driver developers to optimize and fix issues with software.
• Help with debugging, testing, and deployment of small phased array prototypes.
• Desire to try new ideas, explore new paradigms, and invent cool solutions.
• Good communications skills
• Other duties as assigned.

• Adapting to Change – Responds to change with a positive attitude and a willingness to learn new ways to accomplish work activities and objectives

data.job_title: Graduate Intern - Machine Learning and Deep Learning Software Engineer
data.job_description:
This position is associated with the sale of Intel's NAND memory and storage business to SK Hynix (You can read more about the transaction in the press release - https://newsroom.intel.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/11/2020/10/nand-memory-news-q-a.pdf). The transaction will enhance the resources and potential of the business' storage solutions, including client and enterprise SSDs, in the rapidly growing NAND Flash space amid the era of big data.
This is an exciting time to be at Intel - come join our Design Product Test Solutions (DPTS) Team and work on one of the most advanced 3DNAND and SSD technology portfolios in the world. As the global leader in the semiconductor industry, Intel possesses many industry-leading SSD technologies including the most capable Quadruple Level Cell (QLC) NAND Flash products. You will be part of a world-class team that will transition to lead the SSD business at SK hynix.

This position aligns to Phase 2 of the transaction, which includes NAND technology and component development along with fab operations. Employees aligned to Phase 2 will continue to be employed by Intel and will continue to develop NAND technology and components and manufacture NAND wafers at the fab. Phase 2 of the transaction is expected to close in March 2025, at which time employees aligned to this phase of the transaction will transition employment to SK Hynix.

As a contributor with our group, you will work on challenging analytics problems to improve design velocity and reduce uncertainty, including big data and machine learning problems, and with an emphasis on visualization aspects. You will have the opportunity to grow, develop, and network for your future while making real contributions to our innovations.
An ideal candidate would exhibit behavioral traits that indicate:
• Analytical mind with problem solving skills
• Work independently and manage stakeholders
• Deal with ambiguity in defining activities and direction
• Passion for the job
• High motivation with a strong work ethic
• Planning skills
• Judgment
• Written and verbal communication skills

For this opportunity, you must possess analytical, software development and data visualization skills, and meet the qualifications to be considered for this position.

This position is not eligible for employment-based visa/immigration sponsorship. Intel sponsors individuals for employment-based visas for positions where we experience a shortage of US Workers. These skills shortage roles are typically STEM contributing positions requiring a Master's or PhD degree, or a Bachelor’s degree with three years’ related job experience. This position does not qualify for Intel Sponsorship because it is either (1) a non-STEM contributing position, or (2) a STEM position that only requires a Bachelor’s degree and less than three years’ experience

Qualifications

You must possess the minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Relevant experience can be obtained through school work, classes and project work, internships, military training, and/ or work experience.

Education:
• Must be working towards a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or related field.

Minimum Requirements:

Minimum 3+ months of experience or equivalent coursework in the following areas:
• Proficiency in a programming language (Perl, Python, Java, etc)

Preferred Requirements

Minimum 3+ months of experience or equivalent coursework in the following areas:
• Data visualization tools and platforms, particularly DASH (polt.ly) and PowerBI.
• Machine Learning / Deep Learning
• Database systems (including SQL Server and MongoDB)
• Knowledge of Data mining / SQL Server Analysis Services Tabular Models

Inside this Business Group

Non-Volatile Solutions Memory Group: The Non-Volatile Memory Solutions Group is a worldwide organization that delivers NAND flash memory products for use in Solid State Drives (SSDs), portable memory storage devices, digital camera memory cards, and other devices. The group is responsible for NVM technology design and development, complete Solid State Drive (SSD) system hardware and firmware development, as well as wafer and SSD manufacturing.

Other Locations
US, California, Santa Clara

Qualifications: Analytical mind with problem solving skills
Work independently and manage stakeholders
Passion for the job
High motivation with a strong work ethic
Planning skills
Judgment
Written and verbal communication skills
For this opportunity, you must possess analytical, software development and data visualization skills, and meet the qualifications to be considered for this position
These skills shortage roles are typically STEM contributing positions requiring a Master's or PhD degree, or a Bachelor’s degree with three years’ related job experience

This position does not qualify for Intel Sponsorship because it is either (1) a non-STEM contributing position, or (2) a STEM position that only requires a Bachelor’s degree and less than three years’ experience
You must possess the minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position

data.job_title: Data Science and Machine Learning Intern
data.job_description:
Data Science and Machine Learning Intern

Company: Hitachi America, Ltd.

Division: R&D / Industrial AI Lab

Location: Remote USA

Status: Intern, Full-Time

Duration: July – Sept

Summary

Hitachi America, Ltd. has openings for Interns in the Industrial AI Laboratory located in Silicon Valley. The mission of this laboratory is to help create new and innovative solutions that utilize artificial intelligence and advanced analytics for the Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT). The laboratory focuses on research, technology innovation, proof-of-concept activities, technical marketing, and business development for novel AI solutions, leveraging Hitachi’s technologies, reinforcing Hitachi’s messaging around big data, and establishing Hitachi as a leader in Industrial AI.

We are seeking interns in data science (data engineering and analysis, machine learning) to work on innovative data driven solutions and gain insights for smart industry, social innovation, and the Industrial Internet of Things. The successful candidates will have an opportunity to understand and solve challenging real-world problems, and to contribute solutions that will benefit society. You will work in a team environment with significant interaction with researchers.

Minimum Qualifications:
• A Bachelors or Masters student in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operation Research, or related fields.
• Background in data analysis, data engineering, statistics, machine learning algorithms and their applications required.
• Ability to perform literature review of state-of-the-art research papers, summarize and drive conclusions from them.
• Good programming skills and knowledge of data science tools and libraries in Python or R, ability to write SQL queries to extract and analyze data. Knowledge of big data tool/platforms like Spark, Hadoop, Hive is a plus.
• In addition, the successful candidate will possess the following behavioral characteristics:
• Must have strong problem-solving skills
• Must be eager to learn new tools/skills/methods
• Must be a highly motivated team player who can thrive in a dynamic startup-like environment
• Must have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

EOE-Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

If you need a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job at Hitachi, please send the nature of request and contact information to accommodation@hal.hitachi.com. Queries other than accommodation requests will not be responded to.
